abstract: The Warner Music Group’s announcement is the recording industry’s latest move away from its reliance on digital locks to reduce piracy.
snippet: The Warner Music Group’s announcement is the recording industry’s latest move away from its reliance on digital locks to reduce piracy.
lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES  In the recording industry’s latest move away from its reliance on digital locks to reduce piracy, the Warner Music Group said on Thursday that it would sell songs and albums without anticopying software through Amazon’s fledgling digital music service.

headline.main: Amazon to Sell Warner Music Minus Copy Protection
headline.print_headline: Amazon to Sell Warner Music Minus Copy Protection
